title: Acoustic Oscillations on Piezoelectric Materials Excited by a GHz Pulsed Electron Beam
content: Investigation of electronic and vibrational excitations in the infrared region using a transmission electron microscope is traditionally achieved by electron energy-loss spectroscopy (EELS) with a monochromatized electron beam. Currently, the energy resolution has reached a few meV due to the improvement of instrumental stability [1], and the measurable energy range thereby has been expanded to the IR region. On the other hand, to observe lattice vibration phenomena at energies much lower than a few meV, an energy resolution on the order of Î¼eV is required, and has not been achieved at present. Therefore, it is a necessity to develop a new electron spectroscopic technique.
